column4: Hey, I got a computer with a hardware RAID.  Will it be possible to install linux and preserve the current RAID setup?
I've never done it, and so don't know if it can be done.  Is it involved?
the OS will just see the disk space as once disk.
yes, since the controller created a virtual disk from more physical disks the OS will see the disk space as once disk, you just need to make the partitions and format the disk
Badass, will do.  I had an old opensuse livecd that I used to test if the thing turned on, and it wouldn't mount any of the raid disks.
you would need to partition and format it first. So, live CD won't do, just install the OS and during the OS install you can partition and it will format the disk.
So, I can't see the data on the disks?  I have to reformat them?  Bummer.  Why doesn't the liveCD see RAID?
yeah, just also talking to people IRL.  No lspci, it seems.
where did you type that command?
escott:  Oh, I'm dumb.  lspci wasn't in my PATH.  The controllers are a Promise Technology PDC20378, and a VIA Technology VIA VT6420
it's a Sata raid contoller as far I can read that on in the internet
escott:  Seems to be using sata_via and sata_promise, as well as sata1
there is software in the controller... better to use the software raid in linux than a software raid controller because if the controller breaks, you can't recover the data easily.
for a hardware raid controller you would pay a bit more...
when I googled, I saw a thread in a gentoo forum from 2005
